Here are some example exam questions: file:midterm-practice.html

Practice (do not hand in): Problem 1 [2/3]

Given the following code fragment for a class MyClass: 

class MyClass extends Observable {
  void someMethod(){
    ... 
    setChanged();
    notifyObservers();
  }
}

and the following main program fragment:

  MyClass o = new MyClass();
  Observer o1 = new Observer() {... some code ...}
  Observer o2 = new Observer() {... some code ...}
  o.addObserver(o1);
  o.addObserver(o2);
  o.someMethod();

draw an object interaction diagram tracing the method executions beginning with the call o.someMethod(). Your diagram should have columns corresponding to objects o, o1, o2, with the leftmost column being o. Do not include any other objects.

Practice (do not hand in): Problem 2: State [3/3]

Consider the following code:

file:I.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package state.one;
00002: 
00003: interface I {
00004:   public int f();
00005:   public int g();
00006:   public void changeDirection();
00007: }
00008: 
00009: class C implements I {
00010:   private boolean _state;
00011:   private int _i;
00012:   private int _j;
00013:   public int f() {
00014:     if (_state)
00015:       _i += 26;
00016:     else
00017:       _i -= 32;
00018:     return _i;
00019:   }
00020:   public int g() {
00021:     if (_state)
00022:       _j += 42;
00023:     else
00024:       _j -= 27;
00025:     return _j;
00026:   }
00027:   public void changeDirection() {
00028:     _state = !_state;
00029:   }
00030: }
00031:

Refactor using the state pattern.

Draw a UML class diagram of your solution.

Draw a UML interaction diagram of your solution.

Explain the difference between intrinsic and extrinsic state. Which solution type did you use?
